result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant.

Defendant is to submit to any testing probation deems appropriate. Defendant must complete treatment for batterers provided through a certified treatment program or by a certified treatment provider. 
(Per section 767.41(2)(d)1.a)

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges / electronic monitoring approved. Defendant remanded from court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Nicholas J. Pierce.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin

Atty Erickson is heard, defendant needs a few minutes before proceeding. 

Case Recalled: 11:37 AM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Nicholas J. Pierce.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard on sentence. Requests that charge be amended to a misdemeanor battery with $150.00 domestic abuse enhancer. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews min/max penalties. Defendant states understanding. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court accepts defendants plea of no contest and finds defendant guilty. 

State is heard on sentencing. Recommends 150 days in the county jail, court costs - plus domestic abuse surcharge. 
Atty Erickson is heard on sentence and requests electronic monitoring and substance abuse treatment programs. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a withheld sentence and places defendant on probation for 18 months. Conditions - defendant must complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment. Defendant must complete treatment for batterers provided through a certified treatment program or by a certified treatment provider. (Per section 767.41(2)(d)1.a)  
Impose 90 days conditional jail time. Approve Huber privileges/electronic monitoring. 2 days of jail credit upon probation being revoked.  
Defendant is to submit to any testing probation deems appropriate. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. No fine. Court costs plus Domestic Abuse Assessment and DNA. $500.00 bond will be applied. Total of $543.00. $43.00 left to pay after bond applied. 10 DTP. 

Defendant was ready to be remanded from court today.

11:30 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Nicholas J. Pierce.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson is heard on status of this case - requests date for plea/sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:38 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Nicholas J. Pierce.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard on status of the case. No resolution reached yet.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Def. shall have no violent or abusive contact with A.M.W. and not discuss this case with A.M.W.

3:53 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce appeared by video, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared in court for Nicholas J. Pierce, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
     Wit. #1 - Lt. Tara Henry - sworn in, examined by Atty. Steiner.  
3:57 p.m. - No cross by Atty. Erickson.  No further witnesses.  Atty. Steiner moves to bind over.  Atty. Erickson objects.
     Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings.  Atty. Erickson prepared for arraignment today.  Atty. Steiner prepares information for filing.  
     Atty. Erickson notes the victim submitted a safety plan letter and wishes the no contact language be changed to no abusive or violent behavior and that they not discuss the current case.  Atty. Steiner responds.
     Court comments.  Court allows the bond to be modified--remain $500 cash bond; conditions:  Def. shall have no violent or abusive contact with A.M.W. and not discuss this case with A.M.W.  Def. must come to clerk's office to sign before it is changed.  
4:04 p.m. - Information filed; formal reading waived.  Atty. Erickson states Def. stands mute.  Clerk directed by Court to enter a not guilty plea in the record.
     Court concludes at 4:04 p.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:39 PM Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce appeared by video, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Nicholas J. Pierce, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Set for a preliminary hearing
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Ltr to Judge Rider from victim

records.addlTxt:
1:38 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Def is heard, tried to contact the public def office.  Rescheduled initial appearance so he can have more time to get in contact with them.  
Def is given a copy of the criminal complaint.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Nicholas J. Pierce appeared by video. Attorney Rinker appeared by video.  

Court finds probable cause.  

Atty Rinker requests $500.00 cash bond, no contact with A.M.W. 

Defendant comments on bond. Requests $150.00 cash bond. 

Court orders cash bond of $500.00, no contact with A.M.W. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
